content: Write a sonnet about the beauty of space in the style of Shakespeare.

Upon the canvas of the night so vast,
Where stars in silent symphony do play,
A tapestry of light, a wondrous cast,
That fills the soul with awe and steals the day.

The moon, a queen, in silver robes arrayed,
Her glow upon the darkened world does rest,
A beacon to the lovers, side by side,
In quietude, their hearts in harmony crest.

The planets dance in orbits vast and wide,
Each one a world, with secrets yet untold,
Their beauty, mystery, in silence abide,
As time itself seems but a fleeting mold.

Oh, space, thy beauty doth the mind amaze,
A cosmos vast, where wonders never cease to raise.
